abstract.p: CBS Sports has turned down offer to buy same major league baseball television rights NBC has controlled for past five seasons; says it will continue talks (M)

block.p: CBS Sports has turned down an offer to buy the same major league baseball television rights that NBC has controlled for the past five seasons.
''We said no, but we'll continue our discussions,'' said LeslieAnne Wade.
CBS Sports has turned down an offer to buy the same major league baseball television rights that NBC has controlled for the past five seasons.
''We said no, but we'll continue our discussions,'' said LeslieAnne Wade.
Richard Levin, a spokesman for baseball, said, ''Last I heard, they're still negotiating.''
NBC and Fox recently refused baseball's offer to renew their deals at triple the rate they have paid since 1996. Their deals expire after this season.
NBC would not increase its payments to $240 million annually, from $80 million, and Fox rejected a jump to $345 million a year, from $115 million.

CBS's interest has squarely been on NBC's package because it contains only postseason games. Fox's package includes Saturday afternoon regular-season games. Fox and NBC have rotated coverage of the All-Star Game and World Series.
A spokeswoman for ABC Sports had no comment on whether it has also rejected a chance to buy NBC's package.
If baseball scales back its demands, it must first offer the reduced-price packages to NBC and Fox before letting CBS or ABC bid.
